conclusion: Analyze the graph of acceleration as a function of displacement to determine velocity at x = x1.
The graph shows acceleration a is constant and equal to a0 between x = 0 and x = x2.
After x = x2, acceleration decreases linearly until it reaches zero at x = x3.
For 0 ≤ x < x2, the object accelerates at a constant rate a0.
Initial velocity v0 = 0, velocity v at any point x can be calculated using v^2 = v0^2 + 2a0(x - x0).
For 0 ≤ x < x2, v = √(2a0 x) since x0 = 0.
For x2 < x ≤ x3, acceleration is linear, making velocity calculation complex without integration.
Since x1 < x2, object accelerates for distance x1 at constant acceleration a0.
Using v = √(2a0 x1), the magnitude of velocity at x = x1 is √(2a0 x1).
